oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Sgt. John H. Jennings, Co. C, 2nd Tenn. Mtd. Inf., USA to Miss Martha E. Thomas
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from Sgt. John H. Jennings, Co. C, 2nd Tenn. Mtd. Inf., USA to Miss Martha E. Thomas. He writes about having a fever and being in the hospital and says .if we go over their on a scout the rebels would runn us back and bush whack us from every thicket all the way back if was to get a furlough and go home the rebs would ketch me. Jennings was from Decatur County, Tenn. and enlisted at Clifton in April 1864. He was discharged from the army in May 1865.
